Class Wire

java.lang.Object
org.example.circuit_project.Components.Component
org.example.circuit_project.Components.Wire
public class Wire extends Component
Represents a wire component that connects two ports in a circuit. A wire transmits voltage between two ends if both are connected.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class org.example.circuit_project.Components.Component

    view, voltage

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a Wire component with a visual Line object.

    Returns the JavaFX Line associated with this wire.

    Returns both ports (ends) of the wire.

    isPowered()
    Determines if the wire is currently carrying any voltage.

  • Constructor Details

    • Wire

      public Wire(javafx.scene.shape.Line line)
      Constructs a Wire component with a visual Line object.
      Parameters:
      line - the JavaFX Line used to visually represent the wire

  • Method Details

    • getLine

      public javafx.scene.shape.Line getLine()
      Returns the JavaFX Line associated with this wire.
      Returns:
      the Line object representing the wire visually

    • updateLinePosition

      public void updateLinePosition()
      Updates the Line's start and end positions based on connected port locations.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects both ends of the wire from any connected ports. Resets internal voltages and updates visuals.
      Overrides:
      disconnect in class Component

    • simulate

      public void simulate()
      Simulates voltage transmission through the wire based on connections. Voltage is passed from the end that has it to the other end.
      Specified by:
      simulate in class Component

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the voltage on both ports and clears any internal voltage state.
      Overrides:
      reset in class Component

    • getPorts

      public List<Port> getPorts()
      Returns both ports (ends) of the wire.
      Specified by:
      getPorts in class Component
      Returns:
      a list containing the two wire ends

    • propagatePower

      public void propagatePower(Set<Component> visited)
      Propagates power through both ends of the wire to connected components.
      Specified by:
      propagatePower in class Component
      Parameters:
      visited - a set of already visited components to avoid infinite loops

    • isPowered

      public boolean isPowered()
      Determines if the wire is currently carrying any voltage.
      Specified by:
      isPowered in class Component
      Returns:
      true if either end has a non-zero voltage
